title: Deadman: Reborn drop table

properties.name: description
properties.value: Drop rates estimated based on 3,300,000 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

content:
Drop rates estimated based on 3,300,000 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The drop table for Deadman: Reborn is accessed by nearly all monsters killed during the game mode, except for raids and Nightmare Zone.

Contents

  • 1 Rate of access
  • 2 Ancient warrior weapons
  • 3 Sigils
    • 3.1 Tier 1
    • 3.2 Tier 2
    • 3.3 Tier 3
  • 4 Resources
    • 4.1 Emblems
    • 4.2 Subtable 1
    • 4.3 Subtable 2
    • 4.4 Subtable 3
    • 4.5 Subtable 4
    • 4.6 Subtable 5
    • 4.7 Subtable 6
    • 4.8 Subtable 7
    • 4.9 Subtable 8

    • 4.11 Subtable 10
    • 4.12 Subtable 11
      • 4.12.1 Regular
      • 4.12.2 Unique
      • 4.12.3 Mega-rare

Rate of access[edit | edit source]

The rate of accessing this table depends on the combat level of the monster. The newspost claims that boss monsters have an even higher-than-expected chance of rolling the table, but this could not be confirmed.

The probability of rolling for this table after killing a monster with combat level L {\displaystyle L} is approximately:

For monsters level 1 to 50:

P ≈ 1 250 + ⌊ ( 50 − L ) 2 / 5 ⌋ {\displaystyle \mathbb {P} \approx {\frac {1}{250+\left\lfloor (50-L)^{2}/5\right\rfloor }}}

For monsters level 50 to 150:

P ≈ 1 ⌊ 337.5 − L / 1.75 ⌋ {\displaystyle \mathbb {P} \approx {\frac {1}{\left\lfloor 337.5-L/1.75\right\rfloor }}} .

For monsters over level 150:

P ≈ 1 75 {\displaystyle \mathbb {P} \approx {\frac {1}{75}}}

Superior slayer monsters have a guaranteed chance of rolling on this table.

Ancient warrior weapons[edit | edit source]

There is approximately a 1/100 chance to roll the Ancient warrior weapons table. Each weapon has an equal chance to be rolled for.

Monsters in the Wilderness have a significantly higher chance of rolling for Ancient warrior weapons, believed to be approximately twice as high.

Sigils[edit | edit source]

There is approximately a 1/2 chance to roll the sigils table. The sigil given is based on the world bracket you're playing on.

Tier 1[edit | edit source]

Tier 1 sigils can be obtained on 3-35, 36-70, and 71-100 combat level world brackets, and are the only tier of sigils that are dropped on the 3-35 combat level world bracket. There is a 70% chance of them dropping on a 36-70 world bracket and a 20% chance on a 71-100 world bracket.

Tier 2[edit | edit source]

Tier 2 sigils can be obtained on 36-70, 71-100, and 101-126 combat level world brackets. There is a 30% chance of them dropping on a 36-70 world bracket, 75% chance on a 71-100 world bracket, and a 85% chance on a 101-126 world bracket.

Tier 3[edit | edit source]

Tier 3 sigils can be obtained on 71-100 and 101-126 combat level world brackets. There is a 5% chance of them dropping on a 71-100 world bracket and a 15% chance on a 101-126 world bracket.

Resources[edit | edit source]

If you fail to roll for an ancient weapon, sigil or emblem, you'll get two rolls for resources.

The resource tables are broken up into multiple subtables of items that can be rolled for. Each item on all the subtables have the same chance to be rolled for. The roll depends on the monster's combat level using the formula: r a n d o m ( m i n ( n p c C o m b a t L e v e l , 100 ) ) {\displaystyle random(min(npcCombatLevel,100))}

Emblems[edit | edit source]

Tier 1 and tier 5 emblems have a chance to drop on any monster, however if the monster killed is a slayer task or over level 100 the dropped emblem will be a tier 5. The chance appears to be approximately 1/12 per resource drop, and you can only get one emblem per resource drop.

Monsters killed during Wilderness Slayer have additional chances to drop tier 1 emblems.

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Archaic emblem (tier 1)1VariesNot soldN/A
Archaic emblem (tier 5)1VariesNot soldN/A
